title: 3 Simple Ways to Hide Likes and Reactions on Facebook

steps.title: Navigate to your profile page.
steps.content: Navigate to your profile page. Click your profile icon in the top-right corner, and then click your name. Currently, there's no way to change this setting on the Facebook app or mobile website. You can only change this option using a desktop browser.

steps.title: Scroll down to "Likes".
steps.content: Scroll down to "Likes". This section is near the bottom of your page. If you can't find it, click the More tab underneath your name and select Likes .

steps.title: Click ••• next to "Likes".
steps.content: Click ••• next to "Likes". A pop-up menu will open.

steps.title: Click Edit the Privacy of Your Likes.
steps.content: Click Edit the Privacy of Your Likes . This is the second option.

steps.title: Set your privacy permissions.
steps.content: Set your privacy permissions. Click the current setting for each section and set it as "Only me". You'll need to do this for each Like category.

steps.title: Click Close.
steps.content: Click Close . Your Likes will be hidden.

steps.title: Open the Facebook app.
steps.content: Open the Facebook app. If you aren't already logged in , enter your email address or phone number and password to do so now. This method will only hide reactions on posts you created from your profile or feed. This won't count towards posts created in other places, such as Groups, Marketplace, Pages, etc. If you want to hide the Likes on your profile , you'll need to log into Facebook using a desktop browser.

steps.title: Tap ☰.
steps.content: Tap ☰ . On iOS, this will be in the bottom-right corner. On Android, this is at the top-right corner.

steps.title: Tap Settings & privacy.
steps.content: Tap Settings & privacy . You can find this below the app icons.

steps.title: Tap Settings.
steps.content: Tap Settings . A new page will open.

steps.title: Tap Reaction Preferences.
steps.content: Tap Reaction Preferences . This is underneath the Preferences header.

steps.title: Toggle off "On your posts".
steps.content: Toggle off "On your posts". This is the second option. Reactions will be hidden on your posts. If you want to hide reactions on posts created by other people, toggle off On posts from others . [1] X Research source

steps.title: Go to https://www.facebook.com/ in a web browser.
steps.content: Go to https://www.facebook.com/ in a web browser. You can use any browser. If you aren't already logged in, enter your email address or phone number and password to do so now.

steps.title: Click your profile icon.
steps.content: Click your profile icon. This is in the top-right corner. A drop-down menu will open.

steps.title: Click Settings & privacy.
steps.content: Click Settings & privacy . This is the first option underneath your name.

steps.title: Click Settings.
steps.content: Click Settings . A new page will open.

steps.title: Click Reaction Preferences.
steps.content: Click Reaction Preferences . This is in the left panel, underneath Preferences .

steps.title: Toggle off "On your posts".
steps.content: Toggle off "On your posts". This is the second option. Reactions will be hidden on your posts. If you want to hide reactions on posts created by other people, toggle off On posts from others as well.
